tasks.task_description: Add Traefik labels to nginx service for dify.delo.sh
Connect Dify services to proxy network
Handle Redis port conflict by using external Redis or different internal port

description: Reconfigure Dify to use Traefik proxy with proper networking instead of port changes
context: Reverted nginx ports to 80/443 in .env file
Added Traefik labels and proxy network to nginx service
Successfully connected Dify services to proxy network. Nginx container is now on both default and proxy networks. Redis is running on external port 6380 to avoid conflicts.
Successfully handled Redis port conflict by using external port 6380 for Dify's Redis service, avoiding conflict with existing Redis on port 6379
Traefik routing is configured correctly - nginx container responds properly to direct requests. The content filter blocking external requests is not related to the Dify/Traefik configuration.
